channel.title: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?
channel.description: Hey everyone. Recently I found an amazing old school server/client that was like a replica of RuneScape, and it wasn't All-Star based! It has a client that comes with it, but I might as well just use moparscape or Silab client to play it. But the thing is, I'm afraid that most people are tired of old school servers now. I don't want to make a server that will get very little to no players. Here's what it looks like: [img width=800 height=600]http://oi56.tinypic.com/30tqnna.jpg[/img] (I personally love servers and clients like this! I nostalgia hardcore whenever I play on one of these)

item.title: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?

@Uncalled wrote:

Well then most of his projects.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?

item.title: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Many people love the newer servers, and even more love the old, classic look. Didn’t most of us join RSPS development sites, because we missed that age in RuneScape? You shouldn’t base your server off what other people want, but what you want. Then, you will slowly find others who share common interests.

On another note, if you like the newer items, or newer gameframes, use the revision it came out in. Don’t hardcode anything.

I absolutely hate seeing 317s without 317-377 content…[/quote]'Tis why people like you and me are absolutely in love with blakeman’s work, I have only seen him make old-school looking content.
I cannot stand the content within sources such as DSPK, and I’ve seen that my old server has turned into a DSPK source as well [I sold my Uncalled Attack project to someone].

I can’t wait until Apollo get’s released!

Read full topic
item.source: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?

item.title: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I loved the old servers like Pimpscape and Cheezescape 80. These were the basic building blocks of RSPS and were the most fun to see be developed. My next favorite would be the “Czar bases”. The new servers are pretty much all the same, so unless you are really going to put your imagination into it, don’t bother with them.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?

item.title: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Many people love the newer servers, and even more love the old, classic look. Didn’t most of us join RSPS development sites, because we missed that age in RuneScape? You shouldn’t base your server off what other people want, but what you want. Then, you will slowly find others who share common interests.

On another note, if you like the newer items, or newer gameframes, use the revision it came out in. Don’t hardcode anything.

I absolutely hate seeing 317s without 317-377 content…[/quote]

Well put!
Then the old school 317 it is!

Read full topic
item.source: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?

item.title: Do you prefer old school servers/clients?
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:8, topic:381571”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=477383.msg3492775#msg3492775 date=1297046542]
Only beginners who joined RSPS yesterday like the new one. Thus, by looking at the comments above, I prove my statement.

I personally like the old one better but any is good for me
[/quote]
Yeah you do make a point there.

Anyone else willing to share their thoughts?[/quote]

I bet there are a bunch of old players who like the newer ones.

I started RSPS a while ago, but stopped playing all types of RuneScapes. At that time I liked the oldest type of server possible. Now I like the newer ones (1+ years later).

Read full topic
